name: Alterest
slogan: Innovative lending analytics platform for capital providers and loan originators
description:
At Alterest, we make cutting-edge analytical products that provide instant and deep insights for participants in frontier lending markets. The world of credit has been rapidly evolving over the past decade and so is the world of data. With a new-age, innovative, cloud-based loan-analytics platform for capital providers and loan originators alike, Alterest forms the nexus of both those worlds.

We have been backed and supported by top European names: Seedcamp, Simmons & Simmons, PWC and Winton.

jobs.title: Head of Engineering
jobs.description:
We’re a Seedcamp backed company.


We are currently seeking a hands-on, senior engineer, to be located in our London office, who will lead the development of *all* technology within the company. This is a senior role with lots of opportunity for growth. 

Compensation can include early-employee equity option plan and share of business income.


What you'll do
· Lead product and system development. 
· Lead and grow technology teams in London and Bangalore.
· Deliver a technology product that radically improves data analytics and workflows within the lending markets, between capital providers and loan originators.
· Deliver systems to gather, index and analyse millions of data points across public and private data sources relevant to credit and lending markets.
· Implement best-in-class practices of software and technology development using cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure).
· Leverage new and cutting-edge technologies to build user-experiences and computational frameworks for very fast data analysis (including machine learning) and modelling of loan-level data.


Technical skills
· This role is for a hands-on engineer who has built both applications and large-scale data processing systems.
· It is essential that you have been a star programmer for 3+ years and/or an architect for 3+ years in the last 5-7 years. 
· Experience with AWS/Azure-based architecture is required.


Leadership
· You’re more than just the head of engineering; you’re also a leader. You know how to set a vision and rally your team behind it. You know how to motivate your team towards key milestones.


Passion
· You care about what you’re working on. This job would be more than a monthly salary for you. You care about the product, you won’t accept low-quality solutions to critical problems, you won't leave problems in status-quo but will work hard to find solutions.


What you'll have
· Great academic track record, an advanced degree in a computing discipline.
· Work in a top-tier technology company as a developer or architect is critical.


Tech Stack
· Node.js, SQL, NoSQL, Python
· Apache Spark, Hadoop (big data technologies)
· AWS and Azure
· We look to you to improve and introduce new technologies


What can you expect in return
· Learn about next-generation credit and lending markets.
· Talented team members and large potential upside in monetary terms and learnings.
· Build and run a successful global technology team in a young business.
· Interact with innovative market participants who are pushing the boundaries of global finance.
· Have the opportunity to take on a challenging role in a truly fast-paced, start-up environment, where you will form part of the key team that is responsible for turning vision into reality.


We offer a market-leading combination of:
· Base salary of £55,000-70,000 (depending on experience)
· Tax-optimized equity options (1-2%), a share of business income
· Medical insurance
· Collegial office atmosphere

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
THIS IS AN IMMEDIATE HIRE BASED IN LONDON, UK. RELOCATION FROM OUTSIDE OF LONDON AVAILABLE.

We're looking for solid programmers to continue building our cutting-edge loan intelligence product. You will be building an analytical toolkit and extending our data pipeline architecture leveraging latest advancements in front-end frameworks, distributed computing, and data processing techniques.

Essential Requirements:
- Javascript/Node.js
- SQL
- Shell scripting and Unix command line file handling and manipulation
- Practical, hands-on experience with AWS (IAM, S3, EC2, Redshift, RDS, SNS, Lambda)
- Great academic track record

Desirable Requirements:
- Practical experience with ES6, MongoDB, Meteor, Electron
- Advanced SQL (window functions, caching, schema design, understanding of query performance and much more)
- Docker, Python, Auth0
- Advanced degree (Masters or higher)

Intangibles:
- Good sense of design and ability to build software products that are robust and look great

You will:

- Learn about next-generation credit and lending markets.
- Interact with innovative market participants who are pushing the boundaries of global finance.
- Have the opportunity to take on a challenging role in a truly fast-paced, start-up environment, where you will form part of the key team that is responsible for turning vision into reality.

We offer a market-leading combination of:

- Base salary between £45,000 - £70,000
- Equity between 0.05% - 2%
- Incentive-based revenue sharing bonus structure

with other benefits like:

- Medical Insurance with all sorts of rewards like free movie tickets and discounts
- Team lunches and outings, and
- Ultra-cool office space with a community, events and free-to-attend classes.

jobs.title: Quantitative Analyst
jobs.description:
THIS IS AN IMMEDIATE HIRE BASED IN LONDON, UK. 

The role will be hands-on and form an integral part of the team with the potential to turn into a team head or Chief Analytics Officer position.

This is a highly visible role, where you will be working closely with the management and live enterprise customers from day one, contributing to developing new product features alongside enhancing existing platform functionality.

Our application stack is based on modern Javascript frameworks and data processing stack is built on cutting-edge distributed computing architecture.

What you'll do:
- Enhance, implement and head the development of a product used by banks and asset managers to manage and analyse large quantities of loan-level data
- Own and develop the data pipeline and processing architecture
- Devise methods and introduce features that enable valuation of loan portfolios and analytics on cash-flow data
- Proactively explore and implement AI or Machine Learning techniques to aid any new feature
- Interact with enterprise customers to train, support and gain feedback about the product

About you:
- This will suit a person with a minimum of 3+ years’ experience at a premier investment bank, asset manager, hedge fund or consultancy firm within a quantitative credit/fixed income modelling or structuring role
- Demonstrated commercial and quantitative skill set, with attention to detail
- Knowledge of structured credit, securitisation, and fixed income markets
- A self-starter with the mindset and motivation to collaborate and drive projects through to completion
- Dedicated and passionate about working in an inclusive start-up environment
- Enthusiastic about being able to shape the direction of a company and its culture

Technical requirements:
- You have experience coding in Python, SQL and possess advanced Excel knowledge. 
- It is a plus if you have used tools like Moody's/Intex/Bloomberg for modelling and have been exposed to the process of software engineering.

Perks:
- Flexible working option available
- Ultra-cool office in Shoreditch, London, with a fun community and free-to-attend events
- Medical insurance

This is a great opportunity to take on an exciting role in a fast-paced, start-up environment, where you will form part of the key team that is responsible for turning the business vision into reality.

For those on the buy side or sell side, this is a perfect gateway into the start-up world.

jobs.title: Product Manager / Customer Success
jobs.description:
LOCATION: BANGALORE, INDIA.

We are a London-based company looking for a Product Manager to focus on product development, customer success, and company building. This is a highly visible, hands-on and cross-functional role where you will be working closely with teams in London and Bangalore.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Product Development:
-  Work with our team in London to develop a strong understanding of features and roadmap of the Alterest Platform
-  Work closely with our engineers to deliver continuous improvements to the platform
-  Build user-manuals and design-documents for execution by our teams
-  Stay educated about regulatory and market dynamics related to lending and securitization
-  Continuously learn from users and input into product strategy, user experience and roadmap to develop the product further

Customer Success:
-  Assist/lead in pre-sales - involving setting-up and executing demos/trials with enterprise customers
-  Assist/lead implementation and customer success
-  Regularly communicate product updates to customers/users
-  Understand our customers' issues and take ownership of help-desk support to effectively build and communicate roadmaps to tackle these issues with minimal support latency
-  Work with customers to develop testimonials, case-studies, press-releases and lead creation of collateral - such as videos and presentations
-  Design and execute training sessions for our customers

Company Building:
-  Continuously run team check-ins for planning, retrospectives and knowledge transfer to improve efficiency and efficacy of our engineering teams
-  Assist in our hiring process for new candidates
-  Help develop strong team unity and culture and foster an innovative environment with the best employees.

ABOUT YOU:
-  Advanced degree (Masters or higher) in a quantitative or scientific field
-  Prior experience in technology product management
-  Possess strong SQL skills and willingness to rapidly improve
-  Proven commercial and quantitative skill set with attention to detail
-  Experience with BI toolkits, ETL processes, and data management
-  Experience with project management using tools like JIRA or similar
-  3+ years’ experience at a top-tier investment bank, asset manager, hedge fund or consultancy firm within a data, quantitative credit/fixed income role
-  Self-starter with the attitude and motivation to lead, collaborate and drive projects through to completion
-  Dedicated and passionate about working in an inclusive start-up environment
-  Enthusiastic about being an integral part of a young company and growing team!

PLUS:
-  Knowledge about lending and credit markets

ABOUT US:
-  The Alterest Platform is used by banks and asset managers to analyze large quantities of loan-level data and manage related workflows

WHAT WE OFFER:
-  Competitive salary
-  Performance based incentive bonus structure
-  Global financial market and clientele exposure
